path: 2025/Summer/LOS-120 - Stats for Informed Dec Making/LOS-120 - Week 5/Attachments/Chapter 6 Quiz 2.pdf
text: Quiz 2 Chapter 6 As always, show your work. Remember to round your z-scores to two decimal places. IQ scores are normally distributed with a mean of 100 and a standard deviation of 15. 1) What is the probability that a randomly selected person has an IQ of less than 90? 2) What is the probability that a randomly selected person has an IQ of more than 110? The heights of men are normally distributed with a mean of 68.6 inches and a standard deviation of 2.8 inches. 3) What percent of men are less than 5 feet, 6 inches tall? The lengths of pregnancies are normally distributed with a mean of 268 days and a standard deviation of 15 days. 4) Find the probability of a pregnancy lasting more than 280 days. Bonus: What is the probability of a having an IQ between 110 and 120?
